title.narrative: Support to Rohingya communities in Sittwe IDP camps

description.narrative: KKT will initiative and provide a more comprehensive response to the ongoing humanitarian crisis in Rakhine, with specific target to the Rohingya women, living in the 5 IPD camps in Sittwe IDP population estimated roughly 20,000. The project scope comprises of upgrading the current digital literacy package with more advanced courses for recently initiated beneficiaries, and more advanced curricula that include topics of safe browsing, fake news and cyberbullying. This project will improve the beneficiary's knowledge of MNCH, Covid-19 awareness, digital literacy and hate speech during this critical window of opportunity. Training content would go beyond digital literacy and include essential information on family planning, nutrition, gender-based violence and COVID-19. The previous piloted hate speech algorithm would be deployed to specifically capture hate speech against the Rohingya, identifying perpetrators, record semantics and issue periodic reports that feed into counter speech
